thread.title: Prep football: Pleasant Grove holds off American Fork
thread.title_full: Prep football: Pleasant Grove holds off American Fork | The Salt Lake Tribune

title: Prep football: Pleasant Grove holds off American Fork
text:
Pleasant Grove â€¢ Jacob Whitehead's 40-yard field goal was short with six seconds remaining as Pleasant Grove survived to win 27-24 against American Fork on Thursday night.
The Vikings grabbed the lead for the first time with 1:18 left in the game when quarterback Isaac Hamilton connected with wide receiver Malik Overstreet on a 10-yard touchdown.
American Fork seemed to be in control for the better part of the first half, taking control of six penalties against Pleasant Grove.
The Cavemen took the lead early in the first quarter when Whitehead made a 36-yard field goal before the Vikings tied the game at 3 on a field goal by Matt Smyth. 
  Early in the 2nd quarter, American Fork running back Chase Stucki would score on a 1-yard run to make it 10-3 in favor of the Cavemen. The Cavemen increased their lead when running back Christian Snowden scored on a 5-yard rushing touchdown.
With 1:24 left in the first half, Overstreet would score the first of his two touchdowns, this time a 43-yard catch from Hamilton to cut the deficit to 17-10 before the Vikings seized momentum on a 45-yard interception return for a touchdown by Jacob Doman before halftime to tie the game at 17.
American Fork scored first in the second half for a 24-17 lead, then Pleasant Grove kicked another field goal to make it 24-20 before the game-winner late by Overstreet.
